text: I make a lot of chicken stew in the
winter I take my chicken and put it on
to braise and then I usually add
potatoes to the pot but not this time
this time I'm going to use plantains
instead they're gonna thicken the sauce
and I'm also gonna flavor it with a
little bit of orange juice a little bit
of lime juice the whole thing just
becomes tropical and helps me pretend
that I'm somewhere warm
I always like to season my chicken ahead
the farther in advance that you can do
this the more flavorful your chicken is
gonna be so I'm gonna add salt and then
I'm also gonna add some spices just to
deepen the flavor shall we say spiced
things up and then I'm gonna add some
citrus zest whenever I use the juices of
a citrus fruit I often use the zest
along with it because it just
intensifies the flavor and now I do it
with the lime and have very clean hands
I'm just gonna rub all of this all over
the chicken and then I'm gonna put it
away just in the fridge for a couple of
hours or if you have time to do it
overnight that's great
so my chickens been sitting all day it's
ready for the pot you can add about a
tablespoon of oil just enough to kind of
coat the bottom so while the chicken
Browns I'm just gonna cut up the
plantains you can use plantains in any
stage of ripeness for this recipe I want
them to sweet not totally black you see
they're mostly black but they're still
some yellow because I want them to be
firm enough to slice you want to just
cut the tops and then I'm gonna make a
slit going right down the center and I'm
looking for about half-inch ish slices
and what's so great about plantains is
you know they're gonna add that
sweetness which is really nice but
they're also going to throw off a lot of
starch and thicken let's do up and then
with the chickens done I'll fry these up
I'm just gonna check on these and see if
they're ready to flip yes they are
now I'm gonna Brown the plantains right
in this chicken fat
once your plantains are done just
checked for oil just enough to coat the
bottom and then I'm gonna add onion red
pepper and chopped garlic a little more
oregano and then salt 2 teaspoons yeah a
lot of salt and now my liquids I've got
water here orange juice
same orange that I stood and canned
tomatoes I'm gonna bring this to a
simmer and then I'm gonna add the
chicken and plantains back to the pot
just want to give it a stir kind of make
sure everything is tucked in let's just
say and I'm gonna lower the heat cover
it and let it cook for about 25-30
minutes until the chickens just done oh
yeah I can see that that's done that's
practically falling apart because this
is a very sweet tasting stew at this
point it's got the tomatoes and peppers
and onions and plantains so on add
something to kind of zing it up a bit
lime juice olives give that a little
stir time to serve it you could take all
the chicken meat off the bone if you
wanted to you know once it was cool
enough to handle and then put it back in
the stew but I do not have the patience
for them and I'm just gonna put a little
cilantro on for freshness it does have a
little bit of the tropics in there but
mostly it's just a really good chicken
stew plus if you don't tell people what
they're eating they're gonna think what
is is a sweet potato they're not gonna
be sure then you're gonna say plantain
like Wow plantain you never would have
thought of that unless of course they're
from Puerto Rico in which case they will
bite into the plantain and say little
plantain yeah right
